intro: Daviesia pectinata, commonly known as the yellow Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Daviesia pectinata is often found in heathlands and woodlands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
